overview.short: Brucella suis is a small, Gram-negative, non-motile coccobacillus primarily associated with swine and capable of causing chronic brucellosis in humans.
overview.clinical_context: Transmitted mainly through occupational exposure to infected pigs or contaminated animal products.

species_markers.notes: H₂S variability distinguishes B. suis from both B. abortus (positive) and B. melitensis (negative).
Does not require CO₂ supplementation for growth.
Primary reservoir species; aids epidemiological tracing.

common_confusions.reason: Overlap in biochemical reactions and colonial morphology.
Close relatedness can yield false identifications in automated systems.

when_to_question_identification: Strict CO₂ requirement suggests B. abortus.
H₂S-negative reaction may indicate B. melitensis.
Rapid or motile growth rules out Brucella.

recommended_next_tests.reason: Safe confirmatory test under biosafety conditions.
Accurate identification when reference spectra are available.
